edu.blackburn.cs.cs212sp16.coffeeshop

Class Drink

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.blackburn.cs.cs212sp16.coffeeshop.Drink

  • public abstract class Drink
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class holds features common to all drinks; subclasses should be specific types of drinks

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Drink(Customer customer, boolean hot)
      Create a new instance of Drink

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Customer getCustomer()
      Returns the Customer object to whom the drink belongs
      java.lang.String getDrinkType()
      Just pull the name of the appropriate subclass as the type, don't need to store it as a string
      Mixer getMixer()
      Returns the Mixer, or if there is none, sets to half a liter of wheatgrass Flavor
      boolean isHot()
      Determines if the drink is hot or not, which is set at creation, and cannot be changed
      boolean isPickedUp()
      Determines if the drink has been picked up
      void pickUp()
      Will change the return of the isPickedUp() method if the drink has not already been picked up.
      void setMixer(Mixer mixer)
      Set a mixer of any type, but you can only add one hahahahahahah!
      java.lang.String toString()
      Just pull the name of the appropriate subclass as the type, don't need to store it as a string, the add the Mixer

    • Method Detail

      • isHot

        public final boolean isHot()
        Determines if the drink is hot or not, which is set at creation, and cannot be changed
        Returns:
        whether the drink is hot (true) or not (false)

      • isPickedUp

        public final boolean isPickedUp()
        Determines if the drink has been picked up
        Returns:
        whether the drink has been picked up (true) or not (false)

      • pickUp

        public final void pickUp()
        Will change the return of the isPickedUp() method if the drink has not already been picked up. If it has been picked up, there will be no change

      • getCustomer

        public Customer getCustomer()
        Returns the Customer object to whom the drink belongs
        Returns:
        the Customer for the drink

      • setMixer

        public void setMixer(Mixer mixer)
        Set a mixer of any type, but you can only add one hahahahahahah!
        Parameters:
        mixer - the Mixer to add in

      • getMixer

        public Mixer getMixer()
        Returns the Mixer, or if there is none, sets to half a liter of wheatgrass Flavor
        Returns:
        the Mixer that was added, or a secret surprise

      • getDrinkType

        public java.lang.String getDrinkType()
        Just pull the name of the appropriate subclass as the type, don't need to store it as a string
        Returns:
        the string of the whole
